Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): drop obsolete NgFactory and NgSummary config options
Issues.Body:
The options to generate NgFactory and NgSummary files were added to Ivy for backwards compatibility with ViewEngine. Since ViewEngine was deprecated and removed, the NgFactory and NgSummary files are no longer used as well.

This commit drops obsolete options to generate NgFactory and NgSummary files. Also, the logic that generates those files is also removed.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: Initial modernization refactor for i18n digest generation
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [X] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
Instead of relying on a custom implementation of a UTF-8 text encoder that needs to
be maintained by the Angular team, the i18n message digesting process now uses the
native `TextEncoder` class. This class is available for use in all browsers and Node.js
versions supported by the Angular framework (https://caniuse.com/textencoder). The
custom encoder is still used by the compiler's source map generator and cannot yet be
fully removed.
The native UTF-8 encoder (`TextEncoder`) provides its output as a `Uint8Array`
which is a specialized `TypedArray` for storing byte values. To remove the need
to copy and transform this data multiple times, a `DataView` is used to allow
for low-level access to the data in a variety of bit-widths and endianness.
The `DataView` class is natively available and supported by all browsers and
Node.js versions support by the framework (https://caniuse.com/mdn-javascript_builtins_dataview).


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: Make FormControlName directive typed
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

the biggest disadvantage of the `FormControlName` directive is that it's not typed. You can pass anything to the name input, regardless if it's in the form group or not, which might cause runtime exception.
I'm wondering if there is a way that can be improved, so this mistake will be caught in build time.

I'm not even sure if that's technically possible - i.e. can we understand the context of the directive in build time? But I thought it might be worth bringing it up as maybe someone with better expertise than me can help answer that. 

### Proposed solution

`FormControlName`'s input should be typed based on the form group used. Not sure exactly if that's possible and how.

### Alternatives considered

the workaround is not using form control name, and always using "formControl" directive. Which is possible but get annoying if you have a long path of nested controls.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make FormControlName directive typed" (#48255)

Issues.Title: Singleton Services with Standalone Component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

*WARNING: I'm not sure if this is the correct behaviour of a standalone component or not.*

If you import a module with a service, that should be a singleton for your app, in a standalone component it will create a new instance of that service. With the "module way" component this doen't happens, but only when you use a standalone component and it's not clear why.
Same results while boostrap standalone component or module
Using `providedIn: 'root'` in the service decorator doesn't make any difference.
With the service locator pattern it will work, but i don't think this should be the right approach.
If you don't import the module with the service it will work, but why?
If the standalone without import is in the same page with the one with import, it will use the service from the "brother" and not from app, why?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rrptke

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Tested with angular 14, 14.2 and 15.
```


### Anything else?

Please be nice if it's not a bug and I just didn't understood how standalone component works, but this is a new thing and there isn't a guide about that behaviour with services.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Singleton Services with Standalone Component" (#48242)

Issues.Title: fix(platform-browser): reuse server generated component styles
Issues.Body:
**fix(core): generate consistent component IDs**
    
Prior to this change the component IDs where generated based on a counter. This is problematic as there is no guarantee that a component will get the same ID that was assigned on the server when generated on the client side.
    
This is paramount to be able to re-use the component styles generated on the server.


**fix(platform-browser): reuse server generated component styles**
    
Prior to this change component styles generated on the server where removed prior to the client side component being rendered and attached it's own styles. In some cases this caused flickering. To mitigate this `initialNavigation: enabledBlocking'` was introduced which allowed the remove of server styles to be defer to a latter stage when the application has finished initialization.
    
This commit changes the need for this, by not removing the server generated component styles and reuse them for client side rendering.

**refactor(platform-browser): remove internal `TRANSITION_ID` token**
    
This was a mirror copy of the `APP_ID` token.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform-browser): reuse server generated component styles" (#48253)

Issues.Title: Number Pipe not working with persian numbers
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have used number pipe for show list of numbers, but I have got a persian/farsi number like 'Û²Û°' alongside other items in my data and got an error with type 'InvalidPipeArgument'.      
Is there a way to manage this non-english numbers?    
**I would not convert data before binding.**   

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-n1wrjy

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
ERROR
Error: NG02100: InvalidPipeArgument: 'Û²Û° is not a number' for pipe 'DecimalPipe'
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular: 14.x
```


### Anything else?
update: I've solved this problem by add a function to my component:

```
 transformNonNumber(number: string): string {
    const persianNumbers = ['Û°', 'Û±', 'Û²', 'Û³', 'Û´', 'Ûµ', 'Û¶', 'Û·', 'Û¸', 'Û¹'];

    for (var i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
      let reg = new RegExp(persianNumbers[i], "g");
      number = number.replace(re, i.toString());
    }

    return number;
  }
```
Please add this method to number pipe for easier using in future. Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Number Pipe not working with persian numbers" (#48250)

Issues.Title: Component's host directives should be able to inject its `ChangeDetectorRef`
Issues.Body:

### Description

Issues.Title: feat(service-worker): add function to provide service worker
Issues.Body:
## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Feature


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
The only way to register a service worker is by using `ServiceWorkerModule.register()`.
For standalone applications, we must use `importProvidersFrom(ServiceWorkerModule.register(...))`.

Issue Number: #47793


## What is the new behavior?
This PR introduces a function `provideServiceWorker` to replace the call to `ServiceWorkerModule.register()` and hence avoid using `NgModules` to use service workers when building standalone applications.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: Browserslist unique for each project
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

An Angular project with some shared functionality between multiple front-end applications (ex. `./projects/full-client` and `./projects/lite-client`) currently needs to be built via lowest common denominator. The "lite" client is targeting older browsers (like IE11, for example) while the "full" client targets evergreen browsers.

As it stands now, the root `.browserslistrc` file needs to include `ie11` in the list of supported browsers so the "lite" client will compile properly, but that forces the "full" client to compile for IE11 as well.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Each project folder should be able to specify their own `.browserslistrc` file that overrides a root-level one.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We've moved shared functionality to a stand-alone library project, and the two front-ends are separate Angular projects. We'd love to be able to put all three of these under a single project folder and have `npm run build` just work.

Issues.Title: 'update' command using the last stable version introduces unnecessary node version requirements
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If I try to run the `ng update` command with an old local version of the CLI, the CLI attempts to first acquire the 'latest stable version' before running `ng update`.

This creates a requirement for my environment to meet the dependencies of the latest version of the CLI.

This is a problem in some cases if the environment in question is locked to the needs of the version we're targetting. In this case, I'm targeting an update to ng11. However, ng15 requires node ^14.20. 

In the enterprise environment I'm working on we only have certain authorized node versions, none of which are ^14.20.

It seems undesirable to force a user of the CLI to update their environment to use higher versions than the dependencies of the Angular version they wish to update to. 



### Minimal Reproduction

- Have old CLI installed locally (e.g. cli@10.0)
- Have node version < 14.20 loaded 
- run `ng update @angular/core@11.0`
- See error requiring Node ^14.20

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Sorry I can't share this as it's private
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

```json
      "overview": "### Impact\n\nRSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature verification code does not check for tailing garbage bytes after decoding a `DigestInfo` ASN.1 structure. Issues.Body:
```
Similar to errors messages we now hide webpack paths in warnings to reduce clutter.

Before
```

./src/styles.scss.webpack[javascript/auto]!=!./node_modules/css-loader/dist/cjs.js??ruleSet[1].rules[6].rules[0].oneOf[0].use[1]!./node_modules/postcss-loader/dist/cjs.js??ruleSet[1].rules[6].rules[0].oneOf[0].use[2]!./node_modules/resolve-url-loader/index.js??ruleSet[1].rules[6].rules[1].use[0]!./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js??ruleSet[1].rules[6].rules[1].use[1]!./src/styles.scss?ngGlobalStyle - Warning: Module Warning (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
Deprecation $weight: Passing a number without unit % (60) is deprecated.

To preserve current behavior: $weight * 1%

More info: https://sass-lang.com/d/function-units
```

Issues.Title: [15.0.x] fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use url function lexer to rebase Sass URLs
Issues.Body:
When rebasing URLs found within Sass files (sass/scss), the previous regular expression based searching has been replaced with a lexer that scans the Sass files for CSS url() functions and extracts URL values. This change allows for more accurate discovery of URLs as well as reducing the amount of content traversals per file. The lexer logic is based on CSS Syntax Module Level 3 (https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/).

(cherry picked from commit 84dc05d28abdecf9312d91931d155139f1e8ff1f)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[15.0.x] fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use url function lexer to rebase Sass URLs" (#24309)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk Menu / Portal): Portal/Menu isAttached() not working in ShadowDOM
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When **CDK Menu** is placed in component inside **ShadowDom-encapsulated** component, the menu trigger _does_ open the menu, but _does not_ toggle it (when it's open then the click doesn't closes it).
I tracked the issue down through _cdk Menu -> overlayRef -> PortalOutlet -> isAttached()_

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have ShadowDom component
2. Put Angular CDK Menu in this component
3. Try to toggle _cdkMenuTriggerFor_

### Expected Behavior

Should work same as when not in ShadowDom component.

### Actual Behavior

_cdkMenuTriggerFor_ inside ShadowDom doesn't toggle Menu.

Here is the stackblitz with reproducted bug:
**https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rq5d9a?file=src/app/app.module.ts**

Stackblitz is ng 14, but this bug is still there in **Angular 15**.

### Environment

- Angular: 15^
- CDK/Material: 15^

Consider making it working more broadly so it can be used in other cases.

Issues.Title: help(Material theme): Adding theme colors from tailwind to palette
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

I would like to add the theme colors from tailwind's config file to the angular material theme palette using the theme() function from tailwind

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

First tried by declaring a root variable (was using this approach in versions before 15)

```
:root{
   --primary-500:theme(colors.primary.500);
}
```

```
$mat-primary-palette: (
  50: #ffe7e6,
  100: #ffc4c1,
  200: #ff9d98,
  300: #ff766e,
  400: #ff584f,
  500: var(--primary-500),
 ```
 
 This creates the error on the npm start
 > ./src/styles.scss - Warning: Module Warning (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
var(--primary-500) is not a color. Falling back to "dark" tone.

  I also tried adding it straight to the palette
  ```
  $mat-primary-palette: (
  50: #ffe7e6,
  100: #ffc4c1,
  200: #ff9d98,
  300: #ff766e,
  400: #ff584f,
  500: theme(colors.primary.500),
 ```
 This shows an inline error
 
 > identifier or variable expectedscss(css-idorvarexpected)
  

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install tailwind
2. Setup the config file


```
module.exports = {
  content: ["./src/**/*.{html,ts}", "./projects/**/*.{html,ts}"],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        contrast: {
          light: "#fffffff",
          dark: "#000000",
        },
        primary: {
          50: "#ffe7e6",
          100: "#ffc4c1",
          200: "#ff9d98",
          300: "#ff766e",
          400: "#ff584f",
          500: "#ff3b30",
          600: "#ff352b",
          700: "#ff2d24",
          800: "#ff261e",
          900: "#ff1913",
          A100: "#ffffff",
          A200: "#fffafa",
          A400: "#ffc8c7",
          A700: "#ffafad",
        },
        ```
        
3. Try add custom theme colors to material theme palette

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Chome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

Issues.Title: bug(checkbox 15 (not legacy)): Checkbox "checked" not working properly after update to 15th version
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14 (for 15 it's also working for legacy-checkbox)

### Description

Checkbox changes own css-classes even if I have `event.preventDefault()` in (click) handler.
The issue is only for the checkbox (15), not for legacy-checkbox.

It sounds like not a critical issue, but it causes big problems in complex cases (e.g., when I change checkbox state through a ConfirmationDialog). 
It looks like: [checked] attr is changing, but checkbox is not rerendering (and ChangeDetectorRef cannot help too)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create default app (Angular version - 15, AngularMaterial version - 15)
2. Import "new" Checkbox
`import { MatCheckboxModule } from '@angular/material/checkbox';`
3. Set (click) handler with one line inside: `event.preventDefault()`
4. Click on the checkbox

### Expected Behavior

Checkbox doesn't change self state (attr **and** styles/css-classes), if I have `event.preventDefault()`

### Actual Behavior

Checkbox CHANGES css-classes (it's not okay), but doesn't change state (it's okay)

I created two **sandboxes**:
**First one** - legacy-checkbox
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-3657ht?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fmaterial-module.ts
**Second** - checkbox 15 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-wrcpmh?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fmaterial-module.ts

Also, I made **videos**
**Legacy** 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117910324/204268636-e51ac1c0-f971-4bf0-9759-9497c1c95543.mp4
**15** 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117910324/204268673-79fb902f-a36f-438e-bdd4-1d91a57ccdd5.mp4



### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.1
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome all versions
- Operating System macOS Ventura 13.0.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(checkbox 15 (not legacy)): Checkbox "checked" not working properly after update to 15th version" (#26100)

Issues.Title: bug(Input): Input of type="time" doesn't have icon and drop-down anymore
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

`<input matInput type="time">` presents differently in version15.0.0 and does not show the clock icon anymore. Therefore the drop-down to pick a time can no longer be accessed. The time can only be entered via number keys:
![input-timeV15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67003614/204251137-ab1e149f-16f2-43d2-98a5-3949233cf3ef.PNG)

Previous version:
![input-timeV14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67003614/204251213-e429174d-105e-4058-a450-339a442d0387.PNG)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. set type of input to time: 
`<form class="example-form">`
 ` <mat-form-field class="example-full-width">`
    `<mat-label>Pick a time</mat-label>`
    `<input matInput type="time"/>`
  `</mat-form-field>`
`</form>`


### Expected Behavior

Input field shows clock icon and drop-down can be accessed to pick a time via mouse click.

### Actual Behavior

Time can only be entered via number keys.

- Angular: 15.0.0
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0

Issues.Title: fix(material/list): allow mat-list-item outside list
Issues.Body:
In the MDC-based list having a `MatListItem` outside of a list throws a DI error, whereas in the legacy version it didn't. These changes make injecting the list optional and try to gracefully handle the absence of a list.

I've also removed the `mat-mdc-list-non-interactive` class since the same can be achieved without it.

Fixes #26013.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/list): allow mat-list-item outside list" (#26092)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): ripples not being removed if container is hidden
Issues.Body: Fixes that the ripples weren't being removed if the ripple container has `display: none` on it. This is a bit of an edge case that I hit while working on a different task, but it's easy to guard against since we have all the information to know when it happens.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/core): ripples not being removed if container is hidden" (#26096)

Issues.Title: fix(material/card): allow for elevation to be overridden
Issues.Body:

Fixes #26094.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/card): allow for elevation to be overridden" (#26098)

### Is this a regression?

14

### Description

I have some mat-cards with specific elevations set, like for example:  `class=mat-elevation-z4` 
After the upgrade from 14 to 15, the cards are no longer affected by any mat-elevation classes I add. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

Issues.Title: feat(material/select): Allow customizing arrow icon
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

In mat-select component, allow for easily swapping out the arrow icon with a custom one. This was possible in material v14 by overriding CSS properties but now there doesn't seem to be a way to do this in v15 after the switch to MDC components.

### Use Case

UX and branding guidelines may require specific svg icons be used, including the ability the style hover and active states.
